description: Create a new version of your custom platform.

parameters.name: PlatformName
parameters.description: The name of your custom platform.

parameters.name: PlatformVersion
parameters.description: The number, such as 1.0.2, for the new platform version.

parameters.name: PlatformDefinitionBundle
parameters.description: The location of the platform definition archive in Amazon S3. S3Bucket (string) --- The Amazon S3 bucket where the data is located. S3Key (string) --- The Amazon S3 key where the data is located.

nested_params.name: S3Bucket
nested_params.description: The Amazon S3 bucket where the data is located.

nested_params.name: S3Key
nested_params.description: The Amazon S3 key where the data is located.

parameters.name: OptionSettings
parameters.description: The configuration option settings to apply to the builder environment. (dict) --- A specification identifying an individual configuration option along with its current value. For a list of possible namespaces and option values, see Option Values in the AWS Elastic Beanstalk Developer Guide. ResourceName (string) --- A unique resource name for the option setting. Use it for a time---based scaling configuration option. Namespace (string) --- A unique namespace that identifies the option's associated AWS resource. OptionName (string) --- The name of the configuration option. Value (string) --- The current value for the configuration option.

nested_params.name: ResourceName
nested_params.description: A unique resource name for the option setting. Use it for a time---based scaling configuration option.

nested_params.name: Namespace
nested_params.description: A unique namespace that identifies the option's associated AWS resource.

nested_params.name: OptionName
nested_params.description: The name of the configuration option.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The current value for the configuration option.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: Specifies the tags applied to the new platform version. Elastic Beanstalk applies these tags only to the platform version. Environments that you create using the platform version don't inherit the tags. (dict) --- Describes a tag applied to a resource in an environment. Key (string) --- The key of the tag. Value (string) --- The value of the tag.

nested_items.name: PlatformSummary
nested_items.description: Detailed information about the new version of the custom platform.

nested_items.name: PlatformArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the platform version.

nested_items.name: PlatformOwner
nested_items.description: The AWS account ID of the person who created the platform version.

nested_items.name: PlatformStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the platform version. You can create an environment from the platform version once it is ready.

nested_items.name: OperatingSystemName
nested_items.description: The operating system used by the platform version.

nested_items.name: OperatingSystemVersion
nested_items.description: The version of the operating system used by the platform version.

nested_items.name: SupportedTierList
nested_items.description: The tiers in which the platform version runs.

nested_items.name: SupportedAddonList
nested_items.description: The additions associated with the platform version.

nested_items.name: PlatformLifecycleState
nested_items.description: The state of the platform version in its lifecycle.

nested_items.name: PlatformVersion
nested_items.description: The version string of the platform version.

nested_items.name: PlatformBranchName
nested_items.description: The platform branch to which the platform version belongs.

nested_items.name: PlatformBranchLifecycleState
nested_items.description: The state of the platform version's branch in its lifecycle.
